About Me

Greetings!

My name is Huaming Chen. I received my Ph.D degree from School of Computing and Information Technology in University of Wollongong, Australia. I am advised by A/Prof. Jun Shen, A/Prof. Lei Wang from UoW, A/Prof. Jiangning Song from Monash and Dr. Chi-Hung Chi from CSIRO, Australia. I received my Master and Bachelor degrees from DSLab and Honors Class at Lanzhou University, in 2015 and 2012 respectively.

“Study without desire spoils the memory, and it retains nothing that it takes in.” – Leonardo da Vinci

Presentation

The Seventh International Conference on Advanced Cloud and Big Data

Sep, 22, 2019

Topic: Leveraging SMOTE in A Two-Layer Model for Prediction of Protein-Protein Interactions

IEEE NSW and Centre for IT-enabled Transformation (CITT) Joint Seminar.

April 26, 2018

Topic: The Study between Host and Pathogen Interactions

Abstract: The rapid development of high throughput technologies has presented us an opportunity in mining and uncovering the relationships of the biological data. Specifically, the accumulated omics data expose a fundamental scenario for researchers with interest. In this study, we will discuss the topic on drilling computational methodologies to the proteomics study, specifically concerning the interactions between host and pathogens.
